Test Description: Testing basic game understanding and rule understanding.
Question: How many completed features are there in the given landscape?
Rationale: There are a total of 4 features: grass, roads, city, monastery. Out of these, in the given landscape: there are 2 completed roads (one between tile at (2,3) to tile at the tri-road intersection (5,3), and another between the tri-road intersection (5,3) and the city at (4,3)). Along with this there is one completed city (spread across (2,2) and (3,2)). All coordinates are taken with respect to the bottom-left corner of the landscape as (1,1). Therefore, there are a total of 3 completed features in the given landscape.
